definitions.definition: two or more lines that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart at every point

examples.text: The road and the canal are parallel to each other.
The lane is roughly parallel to the main road.
The road runs parallel with the coast.

definitions.definition: very similar or taking place at the same time

examples.text: Though still a committed painter, in 1978 she launched a parallel career as a photographer.
Two poisonings have been reported recently in London and now there has been a parallel case in the Netherlands.

definitions.definition: involving several computer operations at the same time

wordOrigin: mid 16th cent.: from French parallèle, via Latin from Greek parallēlos, from para- ‘alongside’ + allēlos ‘one another’.
